result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Standard felony conditions, not leave the State of WI without written permission of the court, immediately report to the Columbia County jail for fingerprinting and photographing, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia.

1:30 PM Defendant Desty Marie Garrett appeared by video from Columbia County jail.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch appeared by video for Desty Marie Garrett.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. waived reading of complaint, right to attorney recited, $1,000.00 signature bond, standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. waived time limits for preliminary hearing.
